intro: Corynotheca borealis, commonly known as the Arctic snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is well adapted to cold climates. Corynotheca borealis plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of polar environments.
